question: It belongs to you, but your friends use it more. What is it?
I have a tail and a head, but no body. What am I?
You’re running a race and at the very end, you pass the person in 2nd place. What place did you finish the race in?
What 2 things can you never eat for breakfast?
When Grant was 8, his brother was half his age. Now, Grant is 14. How old is his brother?
explanation: Half of 8 is 4, so Grant’s brother is 4 years younger. This means when Grant is 14, his brother is still 4 years younger, so he’s 10.

question: What can you put between 7 and 8, to make the result greater than 7, but less than 8?
explanation: Your result would be 7.8, which is between 7 and 8.

question: What 3 numbers give the same result when multiplied and added together?
It’s raining at midnight, but the forecast for tomorrow and the next day is clear. Will there be sunny weather in 48 hours?
explanation: It won’t be sunny because it will be dark out. In 48 hours, it will be midnight again.

question: I go all around the world, but never leave the corner. What am I?
I make a loud sound when I’m changing. When I do change, I get bigger but weigh less. What am I?
It has keys, but no locks. It has space, but no room. You can enter, but can’t go inside. What is it?
It’s the only place in the world where today comes before yesterday. Where is it?
You’ll find me in Mercury, Earth, Mars and Jupiter, but not in Venus or Neptune. What am I?
A group of bunnies were having a birthday party. What kind of music were they listening to?
What kind of room has no doors or windows?
I’m orange, I wear a green hat and I sound like a parrot. What am I?
What occurs once in a minute, twice in a moment and never in one thousand years?
Which letter of the alphabet has the most water?
I am a word. If you pronounce me rightly, it will be wrong. If you pronounce me wrong it is right. What word am I?
What starts with a P, ends with an E and has thousands of letters?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
How many letters are there in the alphabet?
What ship has two mates, but no captain?
What begins with T ends with T and has T in it?
What kind of tree can you carry in your hand?
If an electric train is travelling south, which way is the smoke going?
answer: There is no smoke; it is an electric train!

question: They come out at night without being called, and are lost in the day without being stolen. What are they?
What is next in this sequence? JFMAMJJASON
answer: The letter “D.” The sequence contains the first letter of each month.

question: I don’t have eyes, ears, nose and tongue, but I can see, smell, hear and taste everything. What am I?
I do not have wings, but I can fly. I don’t have eyes, but I will cry! What am I?
I do not speak, cannot hear or speak anything, but I will always tell the truth. What am I?
I go around all the places, cities, towns and villages, but never come inside. What am I?
I have lots of memories, but I own nothing. What am I?
I have no legs. I will never walk, but always run. What am I?
I have no life, but I can die, what am I?
I have rivers, but do not have water. I have dense forests, but no trees and animals. I have cities, but no people live in those cities. What am I?
I never ask questions, but always answered. What am I?
I was born big, but as the day passes, as I get older, I become small. What am I?
I am full of keys, but I cannot open any door. What am I?
I’m the end of the colorful rainbow. What am I?
If you give me water, I will die. What am I?
Many times you need me. The more and more you take me further, the more and more you leave me behind. What am I?
People buy me to eat, but never eat me. What am I?
When the water comes down, when it rains, I go up. What am I?
You can break me easily without even touching me or seeing me. What am I?
You can keep it only after giving it away to someone else. What is it?
It lives without a body, hears without ears, speaks without a mouth, and is born in air. What is it?
The more you take away, the larger it becomes? What is it?
It has one eye but cannot see? What is it?
It has four eyes but cannot see? What is it?
It has a hundred limbs, but cannot walk? What is it?
It is easy to get into, but hard to get out of? What is it?
It has a bark, but no bite. What is it?
It flies around all day but never goes anywhere? What is it?
This bet can never be won. What is it?
This type of dress can never be worn. What is it?
You can you serve it, but never eat it? What is it?
It comes down but never goes up? What is it?
I am an odd number. Take away a letter and I become even. What number am I?
What did the triangle say to the circle?
Which is heavier: a ton of bricks or a ton of feathers?
If there are three apples and you take away two, how many apples do you have?
How many months of the year have 28 days?
answer: All of them, because every month has at least 28 days.

question: If you multiply this number by any other number, the answer will always be the same. What number is this?
What did one math book say to the other math book?
answer: Do you want to hear my problems?

question: A man has 9 children. Half of them are boys. How is this possible?
How many sides does a circle have?
answer: Two, the inside and the outside

question: Two fathers and two sons are in a car, yet there are only three people in the car. How?
answer: They are a grandfather, father, and son.

question: The day before yesterday I was 21, and next year I will be 24. When is my birthday?
What did the zero say to the eight?
I add five to nine, and get two. The answer is correct, but how?
answer: When it is 9 a.m., add 5 hours to it and you will get 2 p.m.

question: Using only addition, how can you add eight 8’s to get the number 1,000?
